result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey G Hickman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey G Hickman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey G Hickman in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, County Ordinance 63.01.
Defendant plead GUILTY. Court found defendant guilty of the amended charge and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $200.00 inclusive of costs and payable in 60 DAYS or Civil Judgment.
of Representation by Attorney De Leon.

Defendant Jeffrey G Hickman in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for a pre-trial conference. 
Counsel for the defendant contacted and notified the Court that he is in trial in another branch and requested an adjournment. Defendant notified as to next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeffrey G Hickman in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Jeffrey G Hickman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey G Hickman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.   DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
